content: why wait by susan ashcroft yarn malabrigo rasta made with one skein 82 meters / 150 grams choose a needle size that gives a fabric you like gauge is not important the pattern works at any gauge i have average gauge and used 8mm for a fairly dense fabric blue one below 9mm for looser fabric the one on the left knitted flat supplies one stitch marker you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the pattern page on ravelry - link malabrigo rasta arco iris - on 9mm 5 row of seed stitch no need to swatch you begin with just a few stitches which means the start is smaller than any swatch would be so just start and if it s not looking right consider that your swatch and restart tip i always restart with a separate end or ball so that i can have both pieces to compare before deciding which to continue with abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es rs/ws = right side/wrong side sl1 pw wyif = slip one stitch purlwise with yarn in front pm/sm = place marker/slip marker m1r/m1l make one right/make one left you can find good videos demonstrating these increases english and continental style here http //www knittinghelp com/videos/increases rasta reflecting pool - on 8mm 3 row of seed stitch © ashcroft-hempsall 2018 - for personal non-commercial use only why wait 2 making the cowl cast on 3 sts using cable cast-on make sure the cast-on is firm and even link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html row 1 1 rs kfb x2 k1 row 1 2 ws sl1 pw wyif p3 sl1 pw wyif row 1 3 kfb k1 m1r pm k1 m1l kfb k1 row 1 4 sl1 pw wyif purl to last stitch sl1 pw wyif just slip the marker then continue to work rs/ws row as follows 2 1 - rs row kfb knit to marker m1r sm k1 m1l knit to last 2 sts kfb k1 2 2 - ws row sl1 pw wyif purl to last stitch sl1 pw wyif just slip the marker as you come to it work until you can touch the two ends together around your head that way you know it will fit over your head if you prefer to measure measure across the top - approx 55cm/22 - and then work row 3 1 3 1 - rs row knit to marker m1r sm k1 m1l knit to last stitch no more increases at the outside edges to make them form a straight line 3 2 - ws row sl1 pw wyif purl to last stitch sl1 pw wyif when you have enough yarn left for about 5 row start to work the seed stitch border it s not critical how many row you have can be as few as 2 or as many as 6 4 1 - start on the rs k1 p1 work to 1 stitch before the marker
